Method Detail

connect

public boolean connect()
Description copied from class: JibeServiceBase
An asynchronous connection request for the corresponding Jibe Realtime Engine interface. The client application must wait, until the service listener JibeServiceBase.mServiceListener (previously passed to the constructor) has received a callback invocation, indicating that the requested Jibe Service API has now been connected.

The client application should call this function, and then wait for confirmation of connection, before calling any operations on the service.

Overrides:
connect in class JibeServiceBase<ICall>

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Description copied from class: JibeServiceBase
Disconnect from the service.

Called by the client application, when it no longer needs to use the service feature.

Overrides:
disconnect in class JibeServiceBase<ICall>

public boolean isVideoCall(long callId)
                    throws JibeServiceException
Checks whether local or remote video has been added to the specified call.

Parameters:
callId - The call ID.
Returns:
true if local or remote video has been enabled, false otherwise.
Throws:
JibeServiceException - in the case of errors being encountered while invoking the service.

initiateCall

public CallServiceResult initiateCall(int communityId,
                                      java.lang.String remoteUserId,
                                      CameraMediaSource videoSource,
                                      VideoRenderer videoSink)
                               throws JibeServiceException
Initiates a new audio and video call with the given user.

The call state will switch to the CallState.OUTGOING state.

Parameters:
communityId - The identifier for the community.
remoteUserId - The identifier for the remote user.
videoSource - The source for the generating encoded video packets being sent to remote party. Set to null if video should not be sent.
videoSink - The video sink for decoding/rendering incoming remote video. Set to null if video should not be received.
Returns:
CallServiceResult The result of the call - contains the call id of the created call
Throws:
JibeServiceException - in the case of errors being encountered while invoking the service.

acceptCall

public CallServiceResult acceptCall(long callId,
                                    CameraMediaSource videoSource,
                                    VideoRenderer videoSink)
                             throws JibeServiceException
Accepts the incoming call, and activates local video. Sends a positive response to the remote party, accepting the incoming session. Depending on which parameters are set to null, video will be accepted or rejected.

The call state will switch to the CallState.ESTABLISHING state.

Parameters:
callId - The ID of the relevant call.
videoSource - The source for the generating encoded video packets being sent to remote party. Set to null to reject a request for outgoing video.
videoSink - The video sink for decoding/rendering incoming remote video. Set to null to reject a request for incoming video.
Returns:
A result indicating whether or not accepting the call has been successful.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

acceptCallUpdate

public CallServiceResult acceptCallUpdate(long callId,
                                          CameraMediaSource videoSource,
                                          VideoRenderer videoSink)
                                   throws JibeServiceException
Fully or partially accepts the update to an existing call and activates/deactivates video or audio accordingly.

The call state will switch to the CallState.ESTABLISHED state.

Parameters:
callId - The ID of the relevant call.
videoSource - The source for the generating encoded video packets being sent to remote party. Set to null to reject a request for outgoing video.
videoSink - The video sink for decoding/rendering incoming remote video. Set to null to reject a request for incoming video.
Returns:
A result indicating whether or not accepting the update has been completed successful.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

rejectCall

public CallServiceResult rejectCall(long callId)
                             throws JibeServiceException
Rejects the incoming call. The incoming call will be rejected, and no call will be created.

The call state will switch to the CallState.TERMINATING state.

Parameters:
callId - The relevant call ID.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

rejectCallUpdate

public CallServiceResult rejectCallUpdate(long callId)
                                   throws JibeServiceException
Rejects the request to update an existing call (adding video or audio). The call will remain in its previous state.

The call state will switch to CallState.ESTABLISHED state.

Parameters:
callId - The relevant call ID.
Returns:
A result indicating whether or not rejecting the update has been completed successful.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

                                       CameraMediaSource videoSource)
                                throws JibeServiceException
Throws:
JibeServiceException

addRemoteVideo

public CallServiceResult addRemoteVideo(long callId,
                                        VideoRenderer videoSink)
                                 throws JibeServiceException
Throws:
JibeServiceException

addVideo

public CallServiceResult addVideo(long callId,
                                  CameraMediaSource videoSource,
                                  VideoRenderer videoSink)
                           throws JibeServiceException
Adds video to the call. This will start the local video, and send the remote party an offer to start video. If the remote party accepts the incoming video, the local video will be sent to the remote party.

The call state will switch to the CallState.ADDING_VIDEO state.

If local video is already added, this method will do nothing.

Parameters:
callId - The ID of the relevant call.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

removeVideo

public CallServiceResult removeVideo(long callId)
                              throws JibeServiceException
Removes the local video from the call. This will update the call session, removing the local video from the call.

If there is no local video in the call, this method will do nothing.

Parameters:
callId - The ID of the relevant call.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

removeLocalVideo

public CallServiceResult removeLocalVideo(long callId)
                                   throws JibeServiceException
Throws:
JibeServiceException

removeRemoteVideo

public CallServiceResult removeRemoteVideo(long callId)
                                    throws JibeServiceException
Throws:
JibeServiceException

updateCall

public CallServiceResult updateCall(long callId,
                                    CameraMediaSource videoSource,
                                    VideoRenderer videoSink)
                             throws JibeServiceException
Request to update an existing call by adding or removing video.

Parameters:
callId - The ID of the call to update.
videoSource - The source for the generating encoded video packets being sent to remote party. Set to null in order to not add outgoing video or to stop outgoing video if it is currently ongoing.
videoSink - The video sink for decoding/rendering incoming remote video. Set to null in order to not request incoming video or to stop receiving incoming video if it is currently ongoing.
Returns:
A result indicating whether or not the update request has been sent successfully.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

isLocalVideoActive

public boolean isLocalVideoActive(long mCallId)
Returns if the local video is active - meaning the client is SENDING video.

isRemoteVideoActive

public boolean isRemoteVideoActive(long mCallId)
Returns if the local video is active - meaning the remote party is SENDING video.

terminateCall

public CallServiceResult terminateCall(long callId)
                                throws JibeServiceException
Terminates the call, and releases resources associated with the call. A termination request is send to the remote party. The local media resources are stopped and released. Any further calls on this call ID become invalid, except getCallState(long), getCommunityId(long) and getRemoteUserId(long).

The call state will switch to the CallState.TERMINATING state.

Parameters:
callId - The id of the relevant call.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

getCallHoldState

public CallHoldState getCallHoldState(long callId)
                               throws JibeServiceException
Gets the current hold state for the call.

Parameters:
callId - the id of the relevant call.
Returns:
Throws:
JibeServiceException

holdCall

public CallServiceResult holdCall(long callId)
                           throws JibeServiceException
Puts the call on hold. The sending and receiving of media within this call will be stopped. A session update will be sent to the remote party.

Parameters:
callId - The ID of concerned call.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

                             throws JibeServiceException

                                         VideoRenderer videoSink)
                                  throws JibeServiceException
Updates the renderer for incoming remote video. If the session is send only - this has no effect.

Parameters:
callId - The ID of the session to update
videoSink - The updated video sink
Returns:
Throws:
JibeServiceException

isHeadsetRequiredForHandsfree

public boolean isHeadsetRequiredForHandsfree()
                                      throws JibeServiceException
Checks whether echo cancellation is fully supported on the user's handset in order to deliver an optimal handsfree calling experience. If not, the application should recommend to the user to user a headset if a handsfree calling scenario is required.

Returns:
boolean true if a headset is required, false otherwise.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

setMicrophoneMute

public void setMicrophoneMute(boolean isMute)
                       throws JibeServiceException
Mutes/Unmutes the microphone. The Jibe Realtime Engine comes with a built-in audio engine optimized for wireless VoIP which requires this to be set independently of the AudioManaer.

Parameters:
isMute - boolean true to mute, false to unmute.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

isMicrophoneMute

public boolean isMicrophoneMute()
                         throws JibeServiceException
Checks whether microphone has been muted.

Returns:
boolean true if muted, false if not.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

getVoiceCallQualityLevel

public int getVoiceCallQualityLevel(long callId)
                             throws JibeServiceException
Returns the current quality level of the voice call. This is determined by statistics from the RTP stack regarding packet loss and the current quality level selected by the bitrate adaptation scheme.

Returns:
An integer from 0 (worst) to 6 (best) indicating the quality level or QUALITY_LEVEL_UNDEFINED
Throws:
JibeServiceException

getVideoQualityLevel

public int getVideoQualityLevel(long callId)
                         throws JibeServiceException
Returns the current quality level of the video share/video call. This is determined by statistics from the RTP stack regarding packet loss and the current quality level selected by the bitrate adaptation scheme.

Returns:
An integer from 0 (worst) to 6 (best) indicating the quality level or QUALITY_LEVEL_UNDEFINED
Throws:
JibeServiceException

disposeOfAllVideo

public void disposeOfAllVideo()
Disposes of all currently ongoing native video (Video Sharing related or otherwise). Should not be used if there any references to the native video! Use at your own risk!
